subject: Fashion
title: Rise of Fast Fashion
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rise of Fast Fashion usable.

hook.text: In 2000, Americans bought about 50 garments a year. By 2020, that number nearly doubled.

buildup.text: Zara rewrote the rules in the 1990s, slashing design-to-store time from months to just two weeks.

discovery.text: Fast fashion brands now drop up to 52 micro-collections a year‚Äîone new release every single week.

twist.text: Clothes got cheaper, but we didn't save money. We just bought more. Most garments are worn only 7 times.

climax.text: What feels like free choice is a system designed to make you buy, wear once, and toss.

punchline.text: Fast fashion isn't about style. It's engineered waste.

quiz.question: On average, how many times is a fast fashion garment worn before being discarded?
